articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop Meets Chinese Delegation
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop Meets Chinese Delegation
 Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with the delegation of the Chinese State Administration of Radio, Film and Television led by Vice-Minister Li Wei at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Wednesday when it paid a courtesy call on him.

articles.title: Gift from Chinese State Administration of Radio, Film, Television
articles.content:
Gift from Chinese State Administration of Radio, Film, Television
 Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a gift from the Chinese State Administration of Radio, Film and Television.
					 Its Vice-Minister Li Wei on a visit to the DPRK handed the gift to Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, on Wednesday.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Greets Ethiopian PM
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Greets Ethiopian PM
 Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) -- Choe Yong Rim, premier of the DPRK, on September 23 sent a congratulatory message to HaileÔºçMariam Dessalegn upon the assumption of office as prime minister of the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia.
					 Choe in the message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger, wishing him great success in his work for the progress and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Indonesian Youth and Sports Minister Here
articles.content:
Indonesian Youth and Sports Minister Here
 Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) -- Minister of Youth and Sports Affairs of Republic of Indonesia Andi Alifian Mallarangeng and his party arrived here on Wednesday.
					 Samlee Plianbangchang, director of the Regional Office for South-East Asia, and his party departed here on the same day.

articles.title: Congratulatory Messages, Letters from Foreign Personages
articles.content:
Congratulatory Messages, Letters from Foreign Personages
 Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) -- The dear respected          Kim Jong Un received congratulatory messages and letters from foreign personages on the occasion of the 52nd anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership.
					 They included the general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Bangladesh (Marxist-Leninist), president of the Bangladesh People's League, chairman of the Hungarian Communist Workers' Party, spokesman (leader) of the Central Committee of the Revolutionary Communist Party of Britain (Marxist-Leninist), president of the Socialist Party of Benin, chairman of the Socialist Party of Mexico, chairman of the Central Committee of the Socialist Party of Mexico, chairman of the Central Committee of the Socialist Popular Party of Mexico, and the general secretary of the Central Committee of the People's Socialist Party of Mexico.
					
					 Also among them were the director-general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea who is secretary general of the International Kim Il Sung Prize Council, the general secretary of the International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions and dignitaries of political, social and economic circles in Russia, Nepal, Bangladesh, Pakistan, Indonesia, Norway, Germany, Romania, Belarus, Switzerland, Poland, Austria, Ethiopia, Mexico and Colombia and representatives of  international bodies, the Juche idea study groups and bodies for friendship with the DPRK and supporting the reunification of Korea.
					
					 The messages and letters extended the highest regards to Kim Jong Il on the above-said significant day.
					
					 They noted that his field guidance to the Seoul Ryu Kyong Su 105 Guards Tank Division of the Korean People's Army was a historic declaration of the successful succession to the Songun cause.
					
					 Generalissimo Kim Jong Il put the dignity and national power of Juche Korea on the highest level with his original Songun leadership and ushered in a heyday of the prosperity of the country, they said, adding that these feats would shine for all ages.
					
					 They expressed the belief that only victory and glory would be in store for the Korean people holding Kim Jong Un, another illustrious commander of Songun, in high esteem.

articles.title: Reception Given to Celebrate Birthday of PRC
articles.content:
Reception Given to Celebrate Birthday of PRC
 Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) -- The Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and the Central Committee of the DPRK-China Friendship Association Wednesday hosted a reception at Chongryu Restaurant in the run-up to the 63rd birthday of the People's Republic of China (PRC).
					 Present there on invitation were Ambassador Liu Hongcai and staff members of the Chinese embassy here.
					
					 Among those present at the reception were Minister of Public Health Choe Chang Sik who is chairman of the C.C., the DPRK-China Friendship Association, Kim Jin Bom, vice-chairman of the Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and officials concerned.
					
					 Choe Chang Sik said in his speech at the reception that the founding of the PRC marked a historic event which brought about a radical turn in the life of the Chinese people.
					
					 He referred to the fact that the Chinese people have achieved big successes in the efforts to build a comprehensively well-off socialist society under the leadership of the Communist Party of China with Hu Jintao as its general secretary.
					
					 The government of the DPRK will glorify forever the immortal exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il for the development of the DPRK-China friendship and make efforts to boost the traditional friendly and cooperative relations as intended by the top leaders of the two countries, he stressed.
					
					 Ambassador Liu Hongcai said the foundation of the People's Republic of China end the history of subordination and suppression of the people and made them real masters of the state.
					
					 He said he was pleased about the fact that the economy is developing and the people's life is improving in the DPRK under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He said they would deepen the exchange and cooperation in every field in the joint efforts with the Korean comrades in line of the agreement made by the supreme leaders of the two countries and common desire.

articles.title: Chinese Health Ministry Donates Aid Materials to DPRK Health Ministry
articles.content:
Chinese Health Ministry Donates Aid Materials to DPRK Health Ministry
 Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) -- The Ministry of Public Health of China donated aid materials to the Ministry of Public Health of the DPRK.
					 A ceremony for the donation took place in Pyongyang on Wednesday.
					
					 Present there were Vice Minister of Public Health of the DPRK Kang Ha Guk and officials of public health, the visiting Chinese delegation for cooperation in public health, Liu Hongcai, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of the Chinese embassy here.

articles.title: Chinese Central TV Donates Equipment to Central Broadcasting of Korea
articles.content:
Chinese Central TV Donates Equipment to Central Broadcasting of Korea
 Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) -- The Chinese Central TV donated equipment to the Central Broadcasting Committee of Korea. 
					 A donating ceremony took place here on Tuesday.
					
					 Present there were Ri Chol, fire vice-chairman of the Central Broadcasting Committee of Korea, officials concerned, a delegation of the Chinese State Administration of Radio, Film and Television led by Vice-Minister Li Wei, Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Liu Hongcai and embassy officials.
					
					 Speeches were made at the ceremony.
					
					 The participants looked round the donated equipment.

articles.title: Pyongyang Film Festival Participants Visit Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Pyongyang Film Festival Participants Visit Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) -- The participants in the 13th Pyongyang International Film Festival visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung, on September 21.
					 The guests looked round the historic relics, being briefed on the fact that Kim Il Sung was born and spent his childhood in the low thatch-roofed house and nurtured a noble will for revolution.
					
					 After visiting there Daniel Otto, head of the German Film delegation, said that he was honored to visit Mangyongdae.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 An endless stream of people are visiting Mangyongdae.
					
					 Kim Il Sung liberated the country and firmly defended it.
					
					 He was the founder of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					
					 The head of the delegation of the Beijing Movie School from China said that the delegation was deeply impressed to visit Mangyongdae where the President was born, adding that Kim Il Sung provided the friendly relations between the two countries together with the leaders of the elder generation of China.
					
					 The participants also visited the Revolutionary Museum of the Ministry of Culture, Rungna People's Pleasure Park, Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm, Kyongsang Kindergarten, etc. from Sept. 22 to 25.

articles.title: Rungna Dolphinarium Praised by Foreigners
articles.content:
Rungna Dolphinarium Praised by Foreigners
 Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) -- Foreign guests were deeply impressed to visit the Rungna Dolphinarium built on the Rungna Islet on the bank of the picturesque Taedong River. 
					 Basanta Kumar Shrestha, chairman of the International Committee for the Study of Songun Politics for Peaceful Reunification of Korea in Nepal, said the dolphinarium is associated with warm loving care of the dear respected Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 "I was struck with deep admiration at the leadership ability and personality of Kim Jong Un, who has the same noble outlook on the people as that of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, who dedicated themselves to the work for greater happiness of the people," he added. 
					
					 Javed Ahmed Ansari, secretary general of the Society for the Study of Self-Reliance of Pakistan, said a lot of people are visiting the dolphinarium, adding that the Korean people are leading a cultural and emotional life in the recreation grounds built by the state. 
					
					 "I witnessed the happiest people," he noted. 
					
					 Ts. Amarbayasgalang, member of the Mongolian Mt. Paektu Association for Independent Development, said that it was impressive that dolphins surfaced and touched balls to the tune of music.
					
					 "I enjoyed the unforgettable dolphins' presentation together with Korean people," he noted. 
					
					 Rohekele Andre, vice-chairman of the National Committee for the Study of the Juche idea of Democratic Congo, said: "I visited the pleasure ground for people which exists in socialist Korea only. I was impressed to watch dolphins displaying diverse skills." 
					
					  Khaji Mohammad Nazrul, member of the Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea, said: "The Rungna Dolphinarium is marvelous, indeed. It is something surprising to raise dolphins in sea water running through a very long pipe.
					
					 Staying in the DPRK, I deeply grasped the peerlessly great men's idea of believing in the people as in Heaven. 
					
					 I wish the Korean people greater happiness and prosperity."

articles.title: DPRK Soccer Team Beats Its Saudi Arabian Rival 2:1
articles.content:
PRK Soccer Team Beats Its Saudi Arabian Rival 2:1
 Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) -- The DPRK team trounced its Saudi Arabian rival 2:1 in a match on Tuesday at the 2012 Asia U-16 Soccer Championship that started in Iran on Sept. 22.
					 The match between the DPRK team and the south Korean team held on Sept. 23 ended 0:3.
					
					The DPRK team will have its last match with its Japanese rival on Thursday.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Military Camping in Oun-dong
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Military Camping in Oun-dong
 Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) -- University students and youth league officials of the DPRK are nowadays making a tour of the Oun Revolutionary Site in the suburbs of Pyongyang.
					 In the site leader Kim Jong Il conducted military camping from August to October Juche 51 (1962) during his days of study at Kim Il Sung University.
					
					 In the period, he experienced a soldier life with other students, even volunteering to perform mess duty. He stressed that it is hard to get a good understanding of soldiers without experiencing their life and that a brilliant commander's wisdom and courage develop through such life.
					
					 The experience led him to take warm care of soldiers whenever he made inspection tours of military units as the supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 In those days, he put strain into the study of the Juche-based military idea, theories and tactics of President Kim Il Sung, authoring such works as "On the Unique Military Idea of the Great Leader" and "The Factor of Victory in War".
					
					 On the other hand, he worked hard to establish the Korean way of military training suitable to domestic conditions.
					
					 His military life in Oun-dong gives a glimpse of the exploits he performed in guiding the Songun (military-first) revolution for the country and people.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Assails Lee Myung Bak Regime's Anti-DPRK Provocation
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Assails Lee Myung Bak Regime's Anti-DPRK Provocation
 Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak regime's anti-DPRK provocations should never be tolerated as it escalates military stand-off on the Korean Peninsula and brings the danger of a war to it, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a bylined article.
					 The Lee regime's unprecedented anti-DPRK provocations have now become all the more serious, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The regime's sinister design to provoke a war of aggression on the Korean Peninsula in collusion with outsiders and realize its long-cherished ambition of "unification of social systems" has now reached a serious phase that can never be overlooked.
					
					 More serious is that the regime may come out for reckless adventure any time now that it has been pushed to a tight corner, being forsaken by the people and isolated inside and outside. As its ruling foundation is being shaken down to the roots due to its total failure in domestic and foreign policies and ruling crisis that ensued, the regime is trying hard to find a way-out of it in escalating tensions and provoking a war.
					
					 No one can vouch that the regime's reckless anti-DPRK provocation racket would not lead to an all-out war. It is clear that if the south Korean conservative regime's vicious provocation racket is allowed, the nation will suffer the horrible disaster of a nuclear war, much less improving the north-south relations.
					
					 No matter how desperately the puppet regime may try, nothing will save its fate which is already on the wane.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group's Sinister Plot to War against North under Fire
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group's Sinister Plot to War against North under Fire
 Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) -- On Sept. 21 south Korean warships intruded deep into the territorial waters of the DPRK side southwest of Yonphyong Island and fired bullets and shells at random at civilian fishing boats engaged in normal fishing operations. South Korean fighters equipped with missiles made emergency sorties and naval forces in the waters around it were massively reinforced and put on emergency alert, creating an extreme atmosphere of a war.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 These reckless moves of the Lee Myung Bak puppet regime are deliberate and premeditated ones to invent a pretext for armed conflict in waters of the West Sea of Korea at any cost and ignite a war against the north under the pretext.
					
					 It is the basic scenario of the Lee regime keen on invading the DPRK to unleash a local war in waters around the five islands in the West Sea by taking issue with the DPRK and escalate it into an all-out war. 
					
					 The said provocation fully revealed the scenario of the Lee regime to spark off an armed conflict at any cost by regarding civilian fishing boats of other country as its operational target and unleash a war against the north.
					
					 All facts clearly prove that it is none other than the Lee group of traitors that wrecks the peace and stability in the Korean Peninsula and tries hard to provoke a war while threatening even neighboring countries.

articles.title: KCNA Slams Lee Myung Bak Regime's Provocation against DPRK
articles.content:
KCNA Slams Lee Myung Bak Regime's Provocation against DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak regime of south Korea is desperately resorting to provocative acts.
					 On Sept. 21 it opened fire without any prior warning at civilian boats engaged in picking blue crabs in the West Sea of Korea. It even put to sea "combined force", a dangerous military provocation.
					
					 What enrages us further is its claim that it fired "warning shots" in face of the "north's deliberate and planned acts for military provocation."
					
					 This is reckless last-ditch efforts of the Lee regime aimed to prolong its remaining days.
					
					 The south Korean warmongers seek to highlight "security" issue in south Korea with the military provocation as an occasion, deter the public from leaning toward the pro-reunification and democratic forces and thus turn the situation in favor of winning the "presidential" election.
					
					 The Lee regime is being driven into a tight corner in which it can no longer prolong its political life without committing any provocative act.
					
					 It committed the hideous crime of daring hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK and sold off the interests of the south Koreans to foreign forces. For these acts of treachery, the south Korean puppets are finding themselves hard to prolong their remaining days, to say nothing of coming to power again.
					
					 It is for this reason that the traitorous regime has resorted to the last means of maximizing the "security concerns created by the north" in a bid to cook up a shocking case for turning the tide in its favor.
					
					 Traitor Lee and the "Saenuri Party" are the sworn enemies of the nation as they gambled the destiny of the nation to prolong their remaining days.
					
					 The traitorous regime's sordid design can never come true.
					
					 The south Koreans are strongly denouncing the puppet forces' act of firing at the civilian boats, which even the south Korean navy admitted that they had "no special tendency", as an intolerable crime against humanity and a wanton violation of the Korean Armistice Agreement.
					
					 They are jeering and censuring the puppet forces' moves for the provocation of a war as "wrong act" under the pretext of the bogus "northern limit line" and a "reckless act that had not put the domestic affairs into consideration".
					
					 It is clear that this mindset will lead to the stern punishment of the Lee regime.
					
					 If the puppet forces finally fire even a bullet into the inviolable territory and territorial waters of the DPRK with an aim to seize power again, far from drawing a lesson from the recent military provocation, the army and people of the DPRK will mercilessly retaliate against the provokers.
					
					 Only miserable ruin and death await the Lee regime.

articles.title: "Saenuri Party" Urged to Probe Truth behind Its Past Crimes
articles.content:
"Saenuri Party" Urged to Probe Truth behind Its Past Crimes
 Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) -- The organization of victims of the Park Chung-Hee regime in south Korea on Sept. 24 released a statement.
					 The organization groups 18 organizations including the bereaved families' measure committee for probing the truth behind the mysterious cases and the Jon Thae Il Foundation.
					
					 The statement recalled that on the same day Park Geun Hye, "presidential candidate" from the "Saenuri Party", made an apology for the Park Chung-Hee's May 16 military coup, the "yusin" dictatorship and the case of the People's Revolutionary Party under public pressure.
					
					 If her apology were sincere, she should have opted for restoring the committee for settling the past history for truth and reconciliation in order to probe the truth about the past history and reinstating the victims.
					
					 It lashed out at the "Grand National Party", the predecessor of the "Saenuri Party", for playing down the mandate of the committee to look into the cases and obstructing the settlement of the past crimes, and the present regime for disorganizing this body.
					
					 It urged the party to properly approach the past history.

articles.title: S. Korean Presidential Candidate Accused of Shielding Dictatorship
articles.content:
S. Korean Presidential Candidate Accused of Shielding Dictatorship
 Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) -- The society for law on human rights of 11 universities of south Korea including Seoul National University and Yonsei University issued a joint statement, accusing the presidential candidate from the "Saenuri Party" of shielding the fascist dictatorship, according to KBS of south Korea on Sept. 24.
					 The statement riled Park Geun Hye for letting loose a spate of nonsense that the Supreme Court's decision of not guilty over the case of the People's Revolutionary Party fabricated during the period of Park Chung-Hee's "yusin" dictatorship should be left to history to decide.
					
					 Saying that her reckless remarks betrayed her ignorance of law, the statement noted that the society could not repress concern about her wrong understanding of history.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Posted on Website of Nigerian Organization
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Posted on Website of Nigerian Organization
 Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea posted on its website on Sept. 19 the gist of "3. Let's Achieve Independent and Peaceful Reunification of the Country" of President Kim Il Sung's work "Report to the Sixth Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea on the Work of the Central Committee".
					 The third part of the work made public on Oct. 10 1980 deals with the WPK's struggle for reunifying the country in the period under review while indicating tasks for achieving the independent and peaceful reunification of the country.
					
					 It also clarifies a new proposal for establishing the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo based on the three principles of national reunification and the 10-point policy to be implemented by the DFRK.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Inspection Reported by Chinese Media
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Inspection Reported by Chinese Media
 Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) -- Chinese media reported the news on Sept. 22 that the dear respected Kim Jong Un visited the enlarged Pyongyang Vegetable Science Institute and Pyongyang Floriculture Institute.
					 The Chinese News said:
					
					 Kim Jong Un first visited the enlarged Pyongyang Vegetable Science Institute.
					
					 He expressed great satisfaction over the fact that the institute expanded the greenhouse capacity and radically increased the production true to the instructions given by leader Kim Jong Il while visiting the institute in March 2011. 
					
					 At the experimental plots, Kim Jong Un was pleased to hear that it was conducting researches into more than 50 vegetable species including 20 odd species of tomato sent by him. 
					
					 He recollected that Kim Jong Il instructed the institute to cultivate a lot of round eggplants, Phyonggang radish, etc. on an experimental basis while visiting it in March last year.
					
					 He stressed the need to cultivate a lot of high-yielding species of tasty and highly nutritive vegetables suited to the climatic and soil conditions of the country so as to supply sufficient quantities of vegetables to the people.
					
					 The next leg of his guidance was the enlarged Pyongyang Floriculture Institute.
					
					 He was pleased that the institute successfully made floral products with reference to the books he sent to it, adding it would be possible for the flower shops to make floral products including floral baskets and bouquets in the future.
					
					 As the Day of Mother was instituted in the country, it would be nice to buy flowers and present them to mothers and wives on that day, he said.
					
					 The People's Daily of China also carried similar news.

articles.title: 20Kim Jong Suk Remembered by Peruvian Figures
articles.content:
Kim Jong Suk Remembered by Peruvian Figures
 Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) -- A remembrance meeting was held in Peru on Sept. 20 to mark the 63rd anniversary of the death of Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese war hero.
					 Teresa Otiniano, chairwoman of the Peruvian Association for the Study of Revolutionary Activities of Comrade Kim Jong Suk, and Felix Fernandes Torres, secretary general of the Peruvian Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, made speeches.
					
					 The speakers praised Kim Jong Suk for setting an example of loyalty by safeguarding the leader's idea and cause at the risk of her life, saying that she was a renowned political activist who aroused people to an anti-Japanese struggle.
					
					 They said she would always be remembered by the Korean people and the world progressives as she made a great contribution to the Korean revolution and the women's emancipation movement.
					
					 The Korean people will certainly achieve a final victory in the struggle for defending socialism, building a thriving nation and reunifying the country under the wise leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un who is successfully carrying forward the idea and cause of the great men of Mt. Paektu, they said.

articles.title: Osaka Mayor's Remarks to Hide Sexual Slavery under Fire
articles.content:
Osaka Mayor's Remarks to Hide Sexual Slavery under Fire
 Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) -- Civic bodies in Japan on Sept. 23 held a meeting in Osaka in denunciation of the city mayor's reckless remarks to cover up the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army.
					 The mayor in a news interview on Aug. 21 said there is no evidence proving that comfort women were taken by the Imperial Japanese Army in a violent and coercive manner. He said if there took place such practice, it needed evidence to prove it and it was necessary to conduct an argument about it.
					
					 The participants in the meeting bitterly condemned the shameless remarks made by the mayor refusing to admit the sexual slavery in the past.
					
					 Kim Pok Dong, a south Korean victim of the sexual slavery, shouted "I am a witness", bitterly condemning the Japanese imperialists for imposing untold misfortune and sufferings on great many Korean women after forcing them into sexual slavery.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim envia mensaje a su homologo etiope
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim envia mensaje a su homologo etiope
Pyongyang, 26 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El primer ministro del Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Choe Yong Rim, envio el dia 23 un mensaje de felicitacion a Haile-Mariam Dessalegn, premier de la Republica Federal Democratica de Etiopia por su nombramiento de a este cargo.
					  El remitente desea al destinatario grandes exitos en su trabajo para el progreso y la prosperidad del pais y expresa la conviccion de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran mas.

articles.title: Ministerio de Salud Publica de China dona materiales a RPDC
articles.content:
Ministerio de Salud Publica de China dona materiales a RPDC
Pyongyang, 26 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Ministerio de Salud Publica de China dono materiales de ayuda al Ministerio de Salud Publica de Corea.
					La ceremonia de entrega tuvo lugar el dia 26 en esta capital.
					
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes el viceministro de Salud Publica Kang Ha Guk y otros funcionarios coreanos, la delegacion de cooperacion de salud publica de China de visita en Corea, el embajador Liu Hongcai y otros miembros de la sede diplomatica china en Corea.

articles.title: TV Central de China dona a CNRTC equipos
articles.content:
TV Central de China dona a CNRTC equipos
Pyongyang, 26 de septiembre (ACNC) -- La Television Central de China dono al Comite Nacional de Radio y Television de Corea (CNRTC) los equipos.
					Tuvo lugar el dia 25 en esta capital una ceremonia de donacion.
					
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes el primer vicepresidente del CNRTC, Ri Chol, y otros funcionarios coreanos, la delegacion de la Administracion Estatal de Radio, Film y TV encabezada por su vicepresidente Li Wei, el embajador Liu Hongcai y otros miembros de la sede diplomatica china en Corea.
					
					En el acto, hicieron uso de la palabra.
					
					Los participantes recorrieron las instalaciones donadas.

articles.title: ACNC critica a banda de Lee Myung Bak de Sur de Corea
articles.content:
ACNC critica a banda de Lee Myung Bak de Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 26 de septiembre (ACNC) -- La banda del traidor Lee Myung Bak del Sur de Corea recurre desesperadamente a las maniobras provocativas.
					El pasado dia 21, lanzo indiscriminadamente en el Mar Oeste de Corea las balas y proyectiles contra los barcos pesqueros pacificos que se dedicaban a la captura de Portunus trituberculatus (especie de cangrejos) y movilizo con urgencia hasta las "fuerzas de combate conjuntas".
					
					Lo irritable es que la parte surena lo describio como  "tiro de advertencia" a la "accion intencional y planificada del Norte para la provocacion militar".
					
					Esta vez los belicistas surcoreanos intentan  desviar la opinion publica que se dirige a las fuerzas democraticas por la reunificacion dando relieve de la "seguridad" interior del Sur de Corea con motivo de la presente provocacion militar y cambiar a su favor la circunstancia de las elecciones presidenciales.
					
					Hoy, la banda titere se halla en un callejon sin salida.
					
					La imperdonable calumnia a la maxima dignidad de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la venta completa de los intereses de los habitantes surcoreanos a las fuerzas extranjeras hicieron dificil que la banda retome el poder y mantenga su vida restante.
					
					Para salir de este aprieto, la banda titere trata de crear un impacto que cambie la situacion desfavorable al extremar la "crisis de seguridad por el Norte".
					
					Asi, son los enemigos jurados de todos los coreanos el traidor Lee Myung Bak y los tipejos del "Partido Saenuri" que regatean con el destino de la nacion para mantener su vida politica.
					
					La maligna intencion de la banda surcoreana nunca se realizara.
					
					Ahora, los habitantes surcoreanos condenan categoricamente el alboroto militar de los titeres definiendolo como imperdonable crimen antietico y acto de violacion de Acuerdo de Armisticio.
					
					Y burlan diciendo que son erroneas las maniobras de provocacion de guerra de la banda que tomo la "linea de limite al Norte" como pretexto de tiro y "actos imprudentes" que no hizo caso de la situacion domestica para alcanzar su meta en las elecciones presidenciales.
					
					Es evidente que tal opinion publica extendera a la severa sentencia a la banda Lee.
					
					Si los titeres lanzan una chispa aunque sea minima al sagrado territorio y mar de Corea con la ambicion de retomar el poder, en vez de sacar las lecciones en la presente provocacion militar, el ejercito y el pueblo de Corea aniquilaran sin piedad a los provocadores.
					
					A la banda titere del traidor Lee le caeran solo la derrota mas triste y la muerte.
